FuncDef: The pki validate-certificate command allows you to verify the validity of a CA certificate or a local certificate. The pki validate-certificate command allows you to verify the validity of a CA certificate or a local certificate.
CLIs: pki validate-certificate { ca | local } { realm <realm-name> | filename <file-name> }

ParaDef.Info:
Checks validity of the CA certificate.
-

Checks validity of the local certificate.
-

Specifies the PKI realm name of a certificate to be checked.
The value must be an existing PKI realm name.

Specifies the file name of the certificate to be checked.
The value must be an existing certificate file name.

ExtraInfo:
When an end entity verifies a peer certificate, it checks the status of the peer certificate. For example, the end entity checks whether the peer certificate has expired.
To verify the validity of a CA certificate or a local certificate, run the pki validate-certificate command.
